title: Someone stole my account then sold it
body: So I stopped playing league for over a year and then i come back in and im gold and i left bronze which to me doesn't add up so i ask one of the people who he played with and apparently the account was bought and apparently i am breaking a law by not giving money back to someone who bought my account from someone who stole my account what are your thoughts?

replies.body:
Buying an account is just as against the Terms of Service as selling one is.

You should be making every effort to secure the account right now, so that means changing your password and the password of the associated email address at the very least.

I'd also recommend running a virus scan on your computer (I'd recommend Malwarebytes if you don't have an anti-virus), especially so if you don't know how someone else got access to the account in the first place.

I'd also recommend submitting a ticket to [Player Support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) detailing the situation, as the person who bought it may attempt to recover it. They will possibly ask you to prove ownership (by asking a whole bunch of questions about the creation of the account) so that the account can be properly secured.

You aren't in the wrong at all for wanting to recover *your* account. The person who stole the account and the person who bought it are the ones at fault here, regardless of how much time/effort/money the buyer put into the account.

Thank you so much I have already changed the password to the league account and ill be sure to change the password for my gmail being used and get a better virus scan and to contact support.

Thank you so much for the help and advice

I'd recommend you also check out the website https://haveibeenpwned.com/ as it is a great resource to identify when your accounts have been compromised, and can help you identify if this case is more widespread than a single account (in this case being LoL). It may also be prudent for you to check the security of any important accounts you have (such as emails, banks etc.), it's better to be safe than sorry.
